intro: Kelseya uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower kelseya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
